Do Not Say, We Cannot Afford to Work in 
       a Self-supporting Way 


     When I first visited Madison, about five years ago, and looked over this school property, I told those who were with me, that in appearance it was similar to one of the places that had been presented before me in vision during the night season--a place where our people would have opportunity of presenting the light of truth to those who had never heard the last gospel message. . . .
